step_feedback.feedback: Good start! Keep your shoulders and elbows relatively still as you begin.
Focus on keeping your elbows closer to your body and wrists more stable during this movement.
Try to keep your elbows from drifting too far out and stabilize your wrists more.
Your wrists are moving quite a bit here. Aim for more stability in your wrists and elbows.
Continue to focus on stabilizing your wrists and elbows as you complete the movement.
Good job on the second rep! Maintain stability in your shoulders and elbows.
Keep those elbows tucked in and wrists steady as you move.
Work on keeping your elbows from flaring out and stabilizing your wrists.
Your wrists and elbows are showing some extra movement. Focus on keeping them more controlled.
Great effort! Try to minimize wrist and elbow movement to maximize the benefit.

exercise_summary: You're doing a good job with the Push Down Pumping exercise! Focus on keeping your wrists and elbows more stable throughout the movement, especially when pushing down and returning to the start. This will help you get the most out of the exercise.
